title: Expenses and benefits: payments in kind that can be cashed in

details.description: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing 'payments in kind' that can be converted into cash (like cheques or premium bonds) to employees
details.body:
As an employer, payments you make to employees that can be converted into cash, eg a cheque, Savings Certificate or Premium Bond count as earnings.

You must:

  • add their value to your employee’s other earnings
  • deduct and pay tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

Technical guidance

Read more detailed information on employment income: money’s worth: benefits capable of being turned into money.
